title: User manual - ovscout2
text: ovscout2 free, open-source R/Shiny app scouting volleyball matches. provides industry-standard dvw files can used openvolley suite R packages, volleyball analytics software takes dvw files inputs. app offers two modes scouting: using guided point--click interface, typing. Click-scouting easy learn still delivers high-quality scout files. requires video match fixed view point (.e. camera move duration match, least moves occasionally). videos usually taken “scout viewpoint” — behind one end court, reasonable height entire court clearly visible players court tend occlude . app writen R, need R user able use . provide script files launch app command line — see Standalone section installation startup.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: app can run Windows, Linux, Mac systems. possible run app laptop desktop connect tablet similar touch device actual scouting. See Device considerations . need online installation. app initially needs download install additional R packages (quite , fact). app installed run , can used offline thereafter. Also see “system utilities” section, .

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: standalone installer allows run app without anything R.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Install R, following https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/. run R installer administrator — install regular user. Ensure “Save version number registry” box ticked installation. install R administrator, likely get errors ovscout2 tries install additional packages (won’t write-access library directory). can get around also running ovscout2 administrator, better avoid problem installing R regular user first place. Download https://github.com/openvolley/ovscout2/releases/latest/download/ovscout2-win-x64.zip unzip convenient location. Run ov_scouter.bat ov_scouter_demo.bat file. first run take quite time, install number additional R packages. Subsequent startups much faster (checks updates startup, might reinstall packages occasion).

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Install R, following https://cran.r-project.org/. Mac, also need install XQuartz: https://www.xquartz.org/. Optionally install “system utilities” (see ). Download https://github.com/openvolley/ovscout2/releases/latest/download/ovscout2-unix-x64.zip unzip convenient location. Run ov_scouter ov_scouter_demo script. first run take quite time, install number additional R packages. Subsequent startups much faster (checks updates startup, might reinstall packages occasion).

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Install R RStudio. Optionally install lighttpd (see “system utilities” ) RStudio:
code: install.packages("ovscout2", repos = c("https://openvolley.r-universe.dev",                                        "https://cloud.r-project.org")) install.packages("remotes") ## only needed once remotes::install_github("openvolley/ovscout2")

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Two system utilities recommended required. Note standalone Windows bundle already includes utilities — action needed case. pandoc required generating match reports scouted files. Install following https://github.com/jgm/pandoc/blob/master/INSTALL.md. present, report generation menu item won’t shown. starting app RStudio, need install pandoc RStudio comes bundled copy. lighttpd lightweight web server used play match video (using local video file). Install (within R, Windows ) using ovscout2::ov_install_lighttpd() manually http://lighttpd.dtech.hu/ (Windows) via package manager operating systems (see https://redmine.lighttpd.net/projects/lighttpd/wiki/GetLighttpd). lighttpd installed, app falls back servr little slower less responsive lighttpd.

text: scout new match, start app, : using video, define court reference via “Court reference” button. requires click four corners court video image, app can translate click locations video real-world court coordinates. mandatory click-scouting optional type-scouting (don’t , can’t click video order add precise locations ball touches. can click small court diagram instead). Otherwise can enter new teams via “Edit teams” button. hurry, use “ Fast start” button “Edit teams” dialog. automatically populate players numbers 1–99 team. can , scout match, return later (automatically) remove players don’t actually exist assign correct names ones . Enter team lineups set 1, including libero(s) team. two liberos entered, app assume first libero court serve reception (.e. “passing” libero) second libero court serving (“defending” libero). team two liberos one takes court per set, just enter libero actually going play set unpausing video starting scout, check : orientation court diagram (top right) matches video. Swap using ⇵ button required check correct team serving (indicated white circle court diagram). Swap “Change serving team” button required scouting process discussed Scouting detail, .

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: number options available alter behaviour appearance app. can set (starting app within R) via parameters ov_scouter() function. can also set via “Preferences” button app (others added due course): scout_mode sets preferred scouting mode (clicking typing) auto_save_dir directory scouted file saved (.dvw format) rally. can use e.g. provide live file updates used coaching bench scoreboard - show scoreboard top right-hand corner video screen (true default) ball_path - show ball path court diagram (false default, slows app little) review_pane - show video review pane data entry popup (true default) playlist_display_option - show plays table? Either “dv_codes” (scouted codes) “commentary” (plain-language interpretation touches) click_shortcuts - named list defines keyboard shortcuts used app click-scouting mode type_shortcuts - named list defines keyboard shortcuts used app type-scouting mode playstable_shortcuts - named list defines keyboard shortcuts used playstable, click-scouting type-scouting mode

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: ways can tailor click-scouting requirements. can set via ov_scouting_options() function “Click-scouting conventions” pane preferences. include: end_convention determines whether treating end coordinate attack serve actual end location (.e. ball contacted floor bounds area), intended end location. actual might differ intended block touch ball hit net. “actual”, block touch recorded, end location attack used dig location (dig location missing). nblockers default_nblockers. nblockers TRUE data entry include section enter number blockers attack. recommended set TRUE default. default_nblockers value can used set number blockers pre-selected attack. default value might speed data entry process slightly recommended ’s easy forget update attack data include default-valued entries can’t easily distinguish genuine ones actually entered. transition_sets. FALSE, sets transition scouted. entering attack end location (play continues) next click counterattack start location, set scouted . attacks_by allows attacks recorded combination code (“X5”, “V5”, etc) just tempo (high, medium, quick) set_quality. FALSE (default), set actions graded, although set errors -sets (set goes net) marked . set_quality TRUE, data entry include section set can graded “excellent”, “good”, “OK”, “poor”. setter_calls. “setter call” setter instructs middle run. example, setter call “K2” means middle hitter ran behind setter (hit quick ball behind). setter call entered even setter actually set someone else. can set “none” (setter calls), “reception” (setter calls reception-phase attacks ), “” (setter calls recorded reception-phase transition-phase attacks). Setter calls recorded poor reception/dig overpasses. Note scouting transition sets, can’t record setter calls transition setter call code attached setting action. transition_sets FALSE setter_calls “”, treated “reception”.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: introduction type-scouting beyond scope manual. can find information online (paid) courses books. already familiar type-scouting, strongly recommended use click-scouting mode instead. designed allow high-quality match information recorded vastly easier learning curve. type-scout users, aware non-standard scouting codes can used ovscout2 might save keystrokes: starting lineups can entered L codes L 4,7s,8,10,1,3,17 (can use spaces instead commas prefer). first six numbers give players starting positions 1–6, “s” used designate setter. 7th (8th) numbers L optional libero(s). Use aL visiting team lineup. end rally, point can assigned entering p (home team won rally) ap (visiting team). can use shortcut keys, default Ctrl-ArrowUp assign point whichever team top court diagram, Ctrl-ArrowDown team attack combinations can entered without player number. example, home team made X5 attack kill position/cone 3 can enter X53# without player’s jersey number (use aX5... visiting team). ovscout2 automatically infer player number. X5 attack front-row outside hitter, except P1-reception opposite expected hit position 4. Note limitations process: can’t assign player number second-ball attacks (P2 default) overpass attacks (PR); uses attack start zone setter position (team rotation) infer player number; assumes team playing standard player role patterns setter-outside-middle rotation (.e. close outside hitter position 2 setter 1). team plays patterns, assumptions don’t hold particular attack, provide player number scout code usual. setter calls reception need Kx — set action assigned -court setter receiving team. title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Scouted match files allow locations court recorded several different ways differing levels accuracy: zones 3 x 3 grid squares side court (one zone 3m x 3m square indoor court) numbered 1–9 zone can divided four subzones –D (subzone 1.5m x 1.5m square indoor court) coordinates lie 100 x 101 grid covers entire court plus margin around outside , giving locations resolution 10cm.  Zones subzones apply skills. Attack end locations extra option cones, numbered 1–7 (1–8 middle attacks) give direction attack. Attack end locations/directions can stored cones zones file. common (universal) convention scouting cones cone gives intended direction attack, actual direction (two might differ ball deflected block net). conventional scouting software, zones subzones can entered typed-scout codes, coordinates must entered clicking court diagram. ovscout2 click mode, locations recorded coordinates (clicks make video court diagram) converted internally zones subzones. export click-scouted match dvw, option converting attack end locations cone directions, generated attack end coordinates. type-scouting, must choose zones cones attack end location/directions. advisable switch scouting match, existing zone end data converted cones (vice-versa, going way) end inconsistent information match file. possible losslessly convert zones cones: zones don’t map uniquely cones (vice-versa). Coordinates can converted zones cones, aware scouting conventions matter interpreting end result. click-scouted attacks end point actual end point attack (.e. dig location) cone can assigned actual direction attack, necessarily intended direction. click-scouting intended attack end points attacks block touch won’t end point recorded (cone assigned attacks exporting dvw cones, zone exporting dvw zones). set type-scouting preference cones start app partially-scouted file uses zones, app start zone mode consistent already-entered data.

title: User manual - ovscout2

Try playing video file directly web browser (open new tab drag video file onto ). video doesn’t play new browser tab, need re-encode video browser-compatible format (try https://handbrake.fr/, example).

title: An R Shiny App for Scouting Volleyball Match Files
text: similar scouting interface commercial software DataVolley VolleyStation allows fast data entry, can used without video desired (allows live matches can scouted real time scout physically present arena, without muck around live video feeds) type-scouting comes steep learning curve, click-scouting interface exists. software intended scouts access commercial scouting software. click-scouting interface users aren’t proficient keyboard interface. ovscout2 alternative many available tablet- phone-based scouting apps also use click interface, ovscout2 provides complete match data fully dvw compatible can used advanced statistical analysis, yet (hope) remains easy use. unlikely replace professional scouting software used scouts can already capture match data real time.

what: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
text: Create new datavolley match object

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
code: dv_create(   match,   more,   teams,   players_h,   players_v,   video_file,   attacks = ov_simplified_attack_table(),   setter_calls = ov_default_setter_calls_table(),   winning_symbols = ov_default_winning_symbols(),   zones_or_cones = "Z",   regulation = "indoor rally point",   comments )

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
text: match list single-row data.frame: (optional) components date (defaults current date), time (defaults current time), season, league, phase, home_away, day_number, match_number, regulation, zones_or_cones. zones_or_cones can also provided directly list single-row data.frame: (optional) components referees, spectators, receipts, city, arena, scout teams data.frame: 2-row data frame describing home visiting teams, required columns team_id, team optional columns coach, assistant, shirt_colour. home team must first row data frame players_h, players_v data.frame: required columns number, firstname, lastname, optional columns player_id, role (character vector "outside", "opposite", "middle", "libero", "setter"), nickname, special_role (character vector "L", "C", NA), foreign (logical, defaults FALSE) video_file string: (optional) path video file attacks data.frame: returned ov_simplified_attack_table() ov_default_attack_table() setter_calls data.frame: returned ov_default_setter_calls_table() winning_symbols data.frame: returned ov_default_winning_symbols() zones_or_cones string: "Z" "C". ignored zones_or_cones provided match parameter regulation string: "indoor rally point", "beach rally point", "indoor sideout". ignored regulation provided match parameter comments character: optional vector length 5, comments

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
text: datavolley object

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
code: x <- dv_create(teams = data.frame(team_id = c("TM1", "TM2"), team = c("Team 1", "Team 2")),                comments = "Test file",                players_h = data.frame(firstname = toupper(letters[1:7]), lastname = "Player",                                       number = 1:7),                players_v = data.frame(firstname = letters[10:15], lastname = "VisPlayer",                                       number = 10:15))  ## enter the team lineups for set 1 x <- dv_set_lineups(x, set_number = 1, lineups = list(6:1, 15:10), setter_positions = c(2, 1))

title: Default keyboard shortcuts for ov_scouter — ov_default_click_shortcuts
text: Shortcuts defined terms printable representation key (e.g. "", "$", "H", "Escape", "Enter"). See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/UI_Events/Keyboard_event_key_values guidance. Shortcuts can optionally use modifier keys: "Ctrl-x" means pressing control key x simultaneously; similarly Alt-x, Meta-x, Shift-x. aware keys hard-coded specific functionality might cause problems use shortcuts (e.g. "Enter", "Tab"), keys browser-level operating-system-level handling overridden.

what: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
text: Launch Shiny app scouting

title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
code: ov_scouter(   dvw,   video_file,   court_ref,   season_dir,   auto_save_dir,   scout_mode = "click",   pause_on_type = 500,   scoreboard = TRUE,   ball_path = FALSE,   playlist_display_option = "dv_codes",   review_pane = TRUE,   playback_rate = 1,   scouting_options = ov_scouting_options(),   app_styling = ov_app_styling(),   click_shortcuts = ov_default_click_shortcuts(),   type_shortcuts = ov_default_type_shortcuts(),   playstable_shortcuts = ov_default_playstable_shortcuts(),   key_remapping,   scout_name = "",   show_courtref = FALSE,   dash = FALSE,   host,   launch_browser = TRUE,   prompt_for_files = interactive(),   ... )

title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
text: dvw string datavolley: either path dvw ovs file datavolley object (e.g. returned dv_create(). Passing file name (datavolley object) required extra arguments passed via .... dvw can also object saved ov_scouter() ovs format. dvw "demo", app started demonstration data set video_file string: optionally, path video file. supplied (NULL) video file specified dvw file used. video_file can also URL (including YouTube URL video ID) court_ref data.frame string: data.frame court reference (returned ovideo::ov_shiny_court_ref()) path rds file containing output season_dir string: optional path directory dvw/ovs files season auto_save_dir string: optional path directory dvw saved automatically rally scout_mode string: either "click" guided point--click scouting interface, "type" typing-based interface pause_on_type numeric: greater 0 using scout_mode = "type", pause video many milliseconds key press scouting bar scoreboard logical: TRUE, show scoreboard top-right video pane ball_path logical: TRUE, show ball path court inset diagram. Note slow app slightly playlist_display_option string: show plays table? Either "dv_codes" (scouted codes) "commentary" (plain-language interpretation touches) review_pane logical: TRUE, entry popups accompanied small video pane shows loop video action question playback_rate numeric: starting playback rate video (1.0 normal speed, higher faster) scouting_options list: named list entries per ov_scouting_options(). See Details, app_styling list: named list styling options, returned ov_app_styling() click_shortcuts list: named list keyboard shortcuts, returned ov_default_click_shortcuts() type_shortcuts list: named list keyboard shortcuts, returned ov_default_type_shortcuts() playstable_shortcuts list: named list keyboard shortcuts apply plays table, returned ov_default_playstable_shortcuts() key_remapping list: named list key remappings, entries per ov_default_key_remapping(). provided, default ov_default_key_remapping(scout_mode) (whatever scout_mode used) scout_name string: name scout (name) show_courtref logical: TRUE, show court reference lines overlaid video dash logical: support live MPEG DASH streams? specified, default TRUE video_file *.mpd stream. Note DASH support fragile best. HLS streams automatically supported likely reliable host string: IP address machine. required intend run app machine connect different machine (case use ov_scouter(..., host = "www.xxx.yyy.zzz", launch_browser = FALSE) machine, www.xxx.yyy.zzz IP address machine, .e. machine running app) launch_browser logical: TRUE, launch app system's default web browser (passed shiny::runApp()'s launch.browser parameter) prompt_for_files logical: dvw specified, prompt user select dvw file ... : extra parameters passed datavolley::dv_read() (dvw provided string) /shiny server UI functions

title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
text: note scouting_options *.ovs file (.e. partially-scouted file, previously scouted using app) provided dvw argument, contain scouting options used previous scouting session. options re-used EXCEPT scouting_options also provided . scouting options provided via scouting_options argument override options saved .ovs file. Thus, recommended scouting_options provided along .ovs file unless absolutely necessary. necessary, specific, relevant elements scouting_options list provided. Note *.dvw files contain saved options, .ovs files scouted app.

title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
text: Scouting options

title: Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
code: ov_scouting_options(   end_convention = "actual",   nblockers = TRUE,   default_nblockers = NA,   transition_sets = FALSE,   set_quality = FALSE,   attacks_by = "codes",   zones_cones = "Z",   team_system = "SHM3",   setter_dump_code = "PP",   second_ball_attack_code = "P2",   overpass_attack_code = "PR",   default_scouting_table = ov_default_scouting_table(),   compound_table = ov_default_compound_table(),   attack_table = ov_simplified_attack_table(),   setter_calls = "none",   setter_calls_table = ov_default_setter_calls_table() )

title: Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
text: end_convention string: either "actual" "intended". end coordinate attack serve actual end location (ball contacted floor bounds area), intended one. actual might differ intended block touch ball hit net. "actual", block touch recorded, end location attack used dig location (dig location missing) nblockers logical: scout number blockers attack? default_nblockers integer: nblockers TRUE, number blockers default ? NA, default. default value might speed data entry process slightly recommended easy forget update attack data include default-valued entries easily distinguish genuine ones actually entered transition_sets logical: scout sets transition? FALSE, just endpoint attack (.e. dig) subsequent counter-attack scouted set_quality logical: assessing set quality? FALSE sets classified "error", "overpass set", "positive" sets attacks_by string: "codes" (X5, V5, etc) "tempo" (high, medium, quick) zones_cones string: record attack directions "Z"ones "C"ones (ignored scouting 'click' mode, always uses zones. click-scouting can export dvw attack directions cones, wish) team_system string: assumed system teams using assign e.g. passing hitting responsibilities "SHM3" - setter-hitter-middle rotation, 3 passers (libero two outside hitters) setter_dump_code string: attack combination code setter dump second_ball_attack_code string: attack combination code second-ball attack overpass_attack_code string: attack combination code attack overpass default_scouting_table tibble: table scouting defaults (skill type evaluation) compound_table tibble: table compound codes attack_table tibble: table attack codes (X5, V5, etc) returned ov_default_attack_table() ov_simplified_attack_table() setter_calls string: either "none", "reception" (setter calls reception phase ), "" (setter calls reception transition) setter_calls_table tibble: table setter calls (setter instructs middle run) returned ov_default_setter_calls_table()

title: Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
text: named list
